page.title: 13Village and Amenities
page.content: Hamsteels is a small estate at the northern end of Esh Winning.It is predominantly a council housing estate with a few private houses nearby.On the estate there is a communal hall,a fish and chip shop,a primary school and four shops.In the communal hall various activities take place such as bingo,a senior citizens club,a womens guild,and a youth club. The area surrounding the estate is mainly agricultural with a few woods of both deciduous trees and conifers. The farmland is mostly given over to sheep and cattle rearing although some crops are grown. About one mile to the north are two small communities called Cornsay Colliery and Quebec.Herethere are two public houses.
